The dinner hour is the time at which the main meal of the day is eaten.

A meal is an eating occasion that takes place at a certain time and includes specific, prepared food, or the food eaten on that occasion.
Lunch is the second meal of the day, after breakfast. The word is a shortened form of luncheon, which is derived from the fact that lunch was originally a snack eaten at any time of the day or night.
The time of day is the part of a day between morning and evening.

Lunch, the abbreviation for luncheon, is a meal eaten around midday. During the 20th century, the meaning gradually narrowed to a small or mid-sized meal eaten midday. Lunch is commonly the second meal of the day, after breakfast.
It is dinner time.
Lunch is the second meal of the day, after breakfast.

A lunch is a light meal typically eaten at midday. During the workweek, North Americans generally eat a quick lunch that often includes some type of sandwich, soup, or leftovers from the previous night's dinner (e.g., pasta, rice, or meat).
It's lunch time.

The time of day during which a place is in the state of daylight as opposed to darkness.
The time of day is usually determined by a combination of the position of the sun in the sky, the local weather conditions, and the local customs of the area.

The time of day is the part of the day considered as any of the twenty-four-hour periods, conventionally reckoned from one midnight to the next, divided into twelve hours.
